text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.

Question: A square piece of paper has the letter 'F' written on it, facing up as shown below:

    ████
    █
    ███
    █
    █

If you fold this square paper along its vertical midline (from top to bottom) and hold it up to the light from behind, what will the letter look like? Choose from the following options:

A) █████
   █
   ████
   █
   █

B) ████
     █
   ███
     █
     █

C) █████
      █
   ████
      █
      █

D) ████
    █
   ███
    █
    █ 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I have this problem where there's a square piece of paper with the letter 'F' written on it, and it's facing up as shown in the question.
The task is to figure out what the letter looks like after folding the paper along its vertical midline from top to bottom and then holding it up to the light from behind.
The options are A, B, C, and D.
First, I need to visualize the original 'F' on the square paper.
Since it's a square, all sides are equal.
The 'F' is written in a certain way, probably with some lines forming the letter.
I think the 'F' is drawn in a standard way, maybe with three horizontal lines and two vertical lines.
Next, I need to consider folding the paper along its vertical midline.
So, the vertical midline would divide the square into two equal halves, left and right.
When I fold it along this line, the right half will fold over the left half, or vice versa, depending on how I do it.
But since the instruction says to fold from top to bottom, I think the fold goes from the top edge down to the bottom edge, along the vertical center.
When I fold it, part of the paper will overlap the other part.
The letter 'F' is on the entire square, so when folded, some parts of the 'F' will overlap, and others will remain visible.
Since I'm holding it up to the light from behind, the overlapping areas might make the letter appear different because the light will show the colors (or in this case, the ink) from behind.
I need to think about how the folding affects the visibility of the 'F'.
Let me try to imagine the original 'F' and how it would look after folding.
The 'F' has a vertical line on the left and a horizontal line at the top and middle.
When I fold along the vertical midline, the right side of the 'F' will fold over the left side.
So, the part of the 'F' that's on the right side (after the fold) will overlap the left side.
Depending on how the 'F' is structured, some parts might cover up the existing parts, making the letter look different.
Looking at the options, I need to see which one matches the transformation.
Option A seems to have a similar structure but reversed.
Option B looks like it's folded vertically but maybe not in the way I'm thinking.
Option C has a different arrangement, and D seems to have a mirror image but with some parts shifted.
Wait, maybe I should think about how the folding affects the symmetry.
If I fold along the vertical midline, the left and right sides will mirror each other.
So, the letter 'F' on the right side will reflect over to the left side when folded.
But since the paper is being held up to the light from behind, the overlapping areas might make the letter appear as its mirror image or a different orientation.
I'm a bit confused about how exactly the folding would transform the 'F'.
Maybe it would look like the 'F' is mirrored along the vertical midline.
So, the original 'F' on the left would have a mirrored 'F' on the right after folding, but since it's folded, only part of it is visible.
Alternatively, when folded, the 'F' might appear as its mirror image because the right side is folded over the left, and the light shines through, showing the reflection.
Looking at the options again, option D seems to have the same structure but with the 'F' mirrored vertically.
So, the top part is '███', then a single line, then '████', and then two lines.
That might be the result of folding because the right side is now overlapping the left, creating a mirror image.
Alternatively, option C seems to have the same structure as the original but with the top and bottom parts reversed.
Maybe that's because the folding causes the top to be on the bottom and vice versa.
Wait, perhaps I should think about how the folding affects each part of the 'F'.
The original 'F' has a vertical line on the left, a horizontal line at the top, and another horizontal line in the middle.
After folding along the vertical midline, the right side of the 'F' (which is part of the horizontal lines) will now be on the left side.
So, the top horizontal line on the right will now cover part of the left side.
Similarly, the middle horizontal line on the right will also cover part of the left side.
This might make the 'F' appear as if it's mirrored along the vertical midline.
So, the left side remains as is, and the right side is now overlapping the left, creating a mirror image.

Looking at option D, the structure is:

████
 █
████
 █
 █

That seems like the 'F' is mirrored vertically, with the same structure but reversed.
So, the top part is '████', then a single line, then '████', and then two lines.
That might be the result of the folding because the right side is now on the left, creating a mirror image.
Alternatively, option C has the same structure but with the top and bottom parts swapped.
Maybe that's because the folding causes the top to be on the bottom and vice versa.
I'm not entirely sure, but I think option D is the correct one because it's the mirror image along the vertical midline, which is what folding along that line would do.

The correct answer is:

D) ████
  █
  ███
  █
  █

When the paper is folded along the vertical midline, the right side of the 'F' overlaps the left, creating a mirror image.
This results in option D.
